# viewController(for:)

**Instance Method**

Provides a custom view controller to display as part of the compose window.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func viewController(for session: MEComposeSession) -> MEExtensionViewController
```

## Parameters

- **session**: The session that represents the properties of the message in the compose window.

## Return Value

A custom [doc://com.apple.mailkit/documentation/MailKit/MEExtensionViewController] subclass that Mail displays in the compose window.

## Discussion

To configure an icon and tooltip for the compose session handler’s view controller, add the following entries to your extension’s `Info.plist` file:

```plist
<key>NSExtensionAttributes</key>
<dict>
    <key>MEComposeSession</key>
    <dict>
        <key>MEComposeIcon</key>
        <string>YourCustomComposeIconName</string>
        <key>MEComposeIconToolTip</key>
        <string>Tooltip for the compose session handler.</string>
    </dict>
<dict>
```

Include an icon in your extension’s bundle using the name you specify for [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSExtension/NSExtensionAttributes/MEComposeSession/MEComposeIcon].
